org.opends.sdk
Class AuthenticatedConnectionFactory.AuthenticatedAsynchronousConnection

java.lang.Object
  org.opends.sdk.AuthenticatedConnectionFactory.AuthenticatedAsynchronousConnection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, AsynchronousConnection
Enclosing class:
AuthenticatedConnectionFactory
public static final class AuthenticatedConnectionFactory.AuthenticatedAsynchronousConnection
extends Object
implements AsynchronousConnection

An authenticated asynchronous connection supports all operations except Bind operations.

abandon

public void abandon(AbandonRequest request)
             throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                    IllegalStateException,
                    NullPointerException
Description copied from interface: AsynchronousConnection
Abandons the unfinished operation identified in the provided abandon request.

Note: a more convenient approach to abandoning unfinished operations is provided via the ResultFuture.cancel(boolean) method.

Specified by:
abandon in interface AsynchronousConnection
Parameters:
request - The request identifying the operation to be abandoned.
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - If this connection does not support abandon operations.
IllegalStateException - If this connection has already been closed, i.e. if isClosed() == true.
NullPointerException - If request was null.

close

public void close()
Description copied from interface: AsynchronousConnection
Releases any resources associated with this connection. For physical connections to a Directory Server this will mean that an unbind request is sent and the underlying socket is closed.

Other connection implementations may behave differently, and may choose not to send an unbind request if its use is inappropriate (for example a pooled connection will be released and returned to its connection pool without ever issuing an unbind request).

This method is semantically equivalent to the following code: 

 UnbindRequest request = Requests.newUnbindRequest();
 connection.close(request);
Calling close on a connection that is already closed has no effect.

Specified by:
close in interface Closeable
Specified by:
close in interface AsynchronousConnection

close

public void close(UnbindRequest request)
           throws NullPointerException
Description copied from interface: AsynchronousConnection
Releases any resources associated with this connection. For physical connections to a Directory Server this will mean that the provided unbind request is sent and the underlying socket is closed.

Other connection implementations may behave differently, and may choose to ignore the provided unbind request if its use is inappropriate (for example a pooled connection will be released and returned to its connection pool without ever issuing an unbind request).

Calling close on a connection that is already closed has no effect.

Specified by:
close in interface AsynchronousConnection
Parameters:
request - The unbind request to use in the case where a physical connection is closed.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If request was null.

rebind

public <P> ResultFuture<BindResult> rebind(ResultHandler<? super BindResult,P> handler,
                                           P p)
                                throws UnsupportedOperationException,
                                       IllegalStateException
Re-authenticates to the Directory Server using the bind request associated with this connection. If re-authentication fails for some reason then this connection will be automatically closed.

Type Parameters:

search in interface AsynchronousConnection

P - The type of the additional parameter to the handler's methods.
Parameters:
request - The search request.
resultHandler - A result handler which can be used to asynchronously process the operation result when it is received, may be null.
